profile.name: Vikram Switcher
profile.summary: Former Marketing Manager transitioning to Full Stack Development after completing intensive coding bootcamp. Gained hands-on experience in React, Node.js, and modern web technologies. Strong analytical and project management skills from 3 years in marketing.

descriptions: Intensive 6-month program covering HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Node.js, Express.js
Built 5+ full-stack projects including e-commerce site and social media app
Learned Git version control, REST APIs, SQL, MongoDB, and deployment strategies
Graduated with distinction and Best Project Award for final capstone project
Major in Marketing with minor in Finance
Relevant skills: Project Management, Analytics, Problem Solving
Managed digital marketing campaigns for 15+ clients with budget of â‚¹2 crore annually
Analyzed campaign performance using Google Analytics and created detailed reports
Led cross-functional team of 5 designers and content creators
Increased client ROI by 40% through data-driven optimization strategies
Collaborated with technical teams to understand web analytics and tracking implementation
Built full-stack project management application using React frontend and Node.js/Express backend
Implemented user authentication with JWT tokens and bcrypt password hashing
Created RESTful APIs for task management, team collaboration, and project tracking
Used MongoDB for data storage with proper schema design and indexing
Deployed application on Heroku with Git-based deployment pipeline
Added real-time notifications using Socket.io for team updates
Developed complete e-commerce platform with React frontend and Express.js backend
Implemented shopping cart, payment integration, and order management system
Created responsive design using CSS3 and modern layout techniques
Built admin dashboard for inventory management and sales analytics
Used SQL database (PostgreSQL) for product catalog and order processing
Integrated third-party payment gateway and shipping APIs
Created weather tracking app using HTML5, CSS3, and vanilla JavaScript
Integrated third-party weather API for real-time data fetching
Implemented responsive design for mobile and desktop users
Added location-based services and favorite cities functionality
Used Git for version control and GitHub for code repository
